Articles.Content: I don\'t know if its just me but i really dislike looking through the add-ons section to see if there is an updated version of what ever parts I\'m currently using to find ones that are compatible with the newest version. So I had a thought and I\'m sorry if someone had thought of this already but what about having a kind of sub-sections or version specific sections for add-ons such as one being titled something like 'version .14 compatible updates' and '.15 compatible updates' and so on. This was just a thought I had while browsing the add-ons page. It\'s not a big deal I just thought that it would make it a little easier to find updates.

This is actually not a bad idea, myself personally would love to see an add-on repository, like the repo\'s available in most Linux distributions, with a built-in mod enabler as part of KSP.

I have gotten used to the Ubuntu updater telling me when a new version of a particular piece of software is available, and have become lazy when it comes to checking the programs site directly.

I would love something like that.

A updater that would notify you about new version including a summary and a change log would be perfect.

A bit like how Wordpess handles updates.
